segments.en: Linked Discourses 7
2. Lay Followers
13. With Devahita
At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā vātehābādhiko hoti;
segments.en: Now at that time the Buddha was afflicted by winds.

segments.pli: āyasmā ca upavāṇo bhagavato upaṭṭhāko hoti.
segments.en: Venerable Upavāṇa was his carer.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ upavāṇaṃ āmantesi:
segments.en: Then the Buddha said to Upavāṇa,
“Please, Upavāṇa, find some hot water for me.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā upavāṇo bhagavato paṭissutvā nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena devahitassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā tuṇhībhūto ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” replied Upavāṇa. He robed up, and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the house of the brahmin Devahita, and stood silently to one side.

segments.pli: Addasā kho devahito brāhmaṇo āyasmantaṃ upavāṇaṃ tuṇhībhūtaṃ ekamantaṃ ṭhitaṃ.
segments.en: Devahita saw him standing there
and addressed him in verse:
“Silent stands the Master,
shaven, wrapped in his outer robe.
What do you want? What are you looking for?
What have you come here to ask for?”
“The perfected one, the Holy One in the world,
the sage is afflicted by winds.
If there’s hot water,
give it to the sage, brahmin.
I wish to bring it to the one
who is esteemed by the estimable,
honored by the honorable,
venerated by the venerable.”

segments.pli: Atha kho devahito brāhmaṇo uṇhodakassa kājaṃ purisena gāhāpetvā phāṇitassa ca puṭaṃ āyasmato upavāṇassa pādāsi.
segments.en: Then Devahita had a man fetch a carrying-pole with hot water. He also presented Upavāṇa with a jar of molasses.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā upavāṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ uṇhodakena nhāpetvā uṇhodakena phāṇitaṃ āloletvā bhagavato pādāsi.
segments.en: Then Venerable Upavāṇa went up to the Buddha and bathed him with the hot water. Then he stirred molasses into hot water and presented it to the Buddha.
Then the Buddha’s illness died down.

segments.pli: Atha kho devahito brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then the brahmin Devahita went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,

segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho devahito brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: and addressed the Buddha in verse:
“Where should you give an available gift?
Where is a gift very fruitful?
How does one who is donating
ensure the success of their religious donation?”
“One who knows their past lives,
and sees heaven and places of loss,
and has attained the ending of rebirth,
that sage has perfect insight.
Here you should give an available gift;
what’s given here is very fruitful.
That’s how a sponsor of sacrifices
ensures the success of their religious donation.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, devahito brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he had spoken, the brahmin Devahita said to the Buddha,
“Excellent, Master Gotama …

segments.pli: upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
segments.en: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha is ill and sends his attendant monk Upavāṇa to fetch some hot water. A brahmin gives him not just water, but also molasses to ease his stomach. Later the brahmin visits the Buddha to discuss generosity.
